duties_responsibilities.duty: Create a positive school culture and increase student achievement through consistent implementation of instructional practices and strategies.
Oversee all site operations and act as the liaison between the site and the school districts' designated contacts.

Provide vision and leadership to support student achievement and effective operations by supervising staff, developing and implementing performance management plans, and identifying professional learning needs.
Participate in the employment and selection process to ensure an effective site team is in place.
Ensure the safety of staff and students by maintaining the site and classrooms for operation and ensuring compliance with specific state requirements.
Drive the enrollment process from referral to last day of attendance, ensuring timely classroom placement and managing classroom rosters according to student need and state requirements.
Instruct, monitor, and evaluate all staff and students in the use of learning materials and resources to ensure fidelity of instruction and student performance/evaluation.
Participate in the assurance and accreditation processes to ensure that the site meets performance plans.
Prepare and present required reports on student progress, achievement, and activities to ensure accuracy in numerical analysis and presentation.
Compile, analyze, and use assessment data to measure student growth and guide instruction and/or academic intervention for each student and site.
Maintain accurate and complete records of students' progress and development as required by state laws and policies.
Ensure compliance with mandatory requirements including IEP process, state testing, and policies.
Manage student behavior by applying appropriate support or disciplinary measures when necessary.
Provide support, encouragement, and counseling to students with academic problems.

education_certification.credential: Master’s degree in education, special education, psychology, counseling, behavioral analysis, social work, behavioral science, or rehabilitation issued by an accredited postsecondary institution.
Administrative credential granted by an accredited postsecondary educational institution and two years of experience with pupils with disabilities, or equivalent credentials/licenses.
